tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I got my mother's right shoulder Arthroscopy surgery done by Dr. Abhishek. Before seeing him, I consulted close to 6 leading Ortho's in Delhi and finally decided on him.  IMO* ** ** *** **** ***** ******* ** ******  He is very friendly and responds to even WhatsApp messages with a return call.  His team is excellent.  Dr. Veenu is the most friendly physiotherapist I have met.  Pushkar,  who supports patients in deciding on the hospital and helping them to navigate insurance issues is top-class.  Pushkar made our life so easy and we did not have to worry about insurance claim processes.  I strongly recommend Dr. Abhishek and his team for your ortho-related needs.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
My mother consulted Dr. Abhishek Mishra for severe pain and discomfort in her knee. He spent lot of time explaining the issue and also discussed treatment options in detail. My parents being qualified medical doctors themselves were really impressed by the fact that how Dr. Mishra explains complex medical issues in simple terms for a layman.

We decided to go ahead with a knee replacement surgery under supervision of Dr. Mishra. Again, he was very transparent with everything associated with this procedure and answered every question (how so ever trivial) in detail. 

The surgery went very smooth and even though there is pain and discomfort associated with any medical procedure, Dr. Mishra visited my mother daily and made sure that necessary care is extended to her. He also remained in close connect with Physiotherapist to ensure that the exercise routine is updated based on the evolving medical needs of my mother.

This review will remain incomplete without mentioning the wonderful team Dr. Mishra have with him. Special mention and thanks to Mr. Pushkar for always being with us for any question and help. He went way beyond what you would normally expect  to ensure that the best care is provided to my mother.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Excellent doctor, highly recommended ! 

What is expected of a doctor - he listens to the problem, diagnosis and treatment. ** **** * ********** ********** *** *****  this doctor is down to earth. He treats you like a mother.

He operated my mother's knees about 1.5 years ago. I was explained of the problem, the treatment and was given emotional / verbal support to deal with the problem. The relationship is not lost even after so many visits/calls from outstation and have been treated with respect throughout.

His way of treatment and explanations persuaded me to recommend him whenever I certainly  across any case of orthopedic doctor. My colleague was satisfactorily operated for a problem. And recently met him again for my uncle, where he also shared the same experience.

Without doubt, visit him if required. 

Thanks Doctor ! You are awesome !!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Dr. Abhishek Kumar Mishra is very kind and super in his work. I went through ACL reconstruction through arthroscopic. And from the next day I was walking with the help of physiotherapist. And after 4 weeks I was able to walk without any support and achieved full range of knee flexibility. It was good experience although I was scared before surgery. But I wasn't that much painful. And the behaviour of Dr. Sahab was Very kind anytime I msg or call him he replied Very nicely. Super thanks for dr. Abhishek Kumar Mishra and his team. Specially his assistant pushkar manage everything ver wisely. 
Thank you

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,
review: We were extremely satisfied with the service of Dr. Abhishek Kumar Mishra. He listened to the problem of hip replacement of my sister very carefully, evaluated test results, explained the medical problem in details and advised effective treatment protocol. Normally there were a gap between patient and doctor in terms of communication. Dr. Mishra was so kind enough and was easy to communicate. ** ** **** **** ************* ** *** ***** ** *********** ******** *** ** *** **** ****** * **** **** ******* *** *** ******* ******* ** ** ******* I have been living in USA and lived in Japan during last 20 yrs. Dr. Mishra can be within 1% of top orthopaedic surgeon around the globe. May God Bless him.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
The best ACL reconstruction and Orthopaedic Doctor I've ever visited.
I had a serious ACL tear and thought my days of playing Football or even running were over.  
Even though it was a Sunday, the Doctor saw me immediately, examined my injury and put in action a reconstruction and recovery plan that has seen me heal completely since the surgery. 
He's very kind with his patients and extremely informative on what's the right treatment for the given medical issue. 
I'd highly recommend him to anyone.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I am writing my experience almost after 1 year as I was very skeptical with the result of knee surgery done for my mother, more both the knees together. Today, after 1 year, I can vote for him for all the expertise he has. For any doctor, the very important thing is his/her patients is comfortable so he and his staff made sure of that. 

To start with my first meeting, I was little late because of traffic so he made sure to meet me than just leave. He explained everything in detail and suggested to go for both knee replacement together. More than me, he took away fear from my mom which was more important. Not only with the treatment, he also made sure discussing my financial comfort and helped me with all stress free arrangement at Apollo spectra. 

I can keep writing pages but in short, he and his team, specially Pushkar made weekly visits for more than a month to check how my mom is doing and how physio results are. As promised, my mom could stand after a day and walk with support after a week. After 2 months, my mom called me and she was in tears of happiness that she walked around 2 km outside home and very happy with her freedom. Till date, if me or my mom calls doctor office, they respond and recognize us well. 

Truly, very humbled and admired by your personality. I am sure, you must have helped many others in last one year. All the blessings and success to you and your team.
reply_text:
Thanks a lot.
These encouraging words are what makes a surgeon's job worthwhile.
God Bless.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: my  mother (86 yo ) had very bad fall . As a result she was in extreme pain, completely immobilised. Initially we admitted her in nearby prominent hospital. After very bad experience there luckily our friends suggested to bring her to Dr Abhishek Mishra !  He and the whole his team was our saviors . Lots of patience, confidence, huge experience and  excellent skills made the magic and after few weeks she was on her feet again without any surgery! I would highly recommend Dr Abhishek !

tags: None
review: I liked the doctor in my first visit to his clinic but the second visit was thoroughly disappointing. Waited for hours on end and he didn't even bother to show up! For a clinic that gives the appointment at 6pm, he hadn't even turned up till 8pm. Very disappointing as a patient to travel all the way with all the pain and everything in vain. Can understand the possibility of an exigency but can't understand the lack of basic courtesy to keep a patient informed. Won't go there myself and won't recommend visiting him if you are a stickler of time.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
The plaster that they did *** ***** *** ** broke the next day. Even after that it pained me a lot. The doctor was always not available *** **** *** **** ********** ** ************ ***** ***** ** *** **** ***** **** *** *** ******** ******** ** *** ****** 
I have had this ligament injury since 5 months *** *** ** ****** ****** ******* * ** ** * *** ** **** ****** Very unsatisfied.
reply_text:
Extremely sorry for the inconvenience caused to you. Any cast ( plaster) is liable to breakage if it is subjected to weight bearing without plaster shoe/cast boot. Everytime a cast is applied patients are instructed to wear the same. Despite repeated emphasis some patients do not follow the advice and come back with a broken cast.
The natural course of injuries are different in different people depending on the body response and it would be wrong to predict the exact outcome in each and every individual. That is why follow ups are suggested.
It would be wrong to say that doctor is always not available as the doctor has to be in surgery as well and that is why the concept of prior appointment.
'only interested in consultation money' statement has probably arisen out of a discontent and biased opinion.
Would request you to kindly fix up an appointment with me.
Would ensure that your queries are attended to personally.
Thanx and regards
Dr Abhishek

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: If we book an appointment the allocated time should be considered . I am completely satisfied with the Dr but the only issue is wait time . I had to wait for 45 mins despite of reaching before time and then had to ask the Reception to consider as wait time was too much for my patient to sit in the chamber. The Dr has walk in customers as well so it has First cum first basis , then I guess we dont need to book an appointment .
reply_text:
Dear Sir
Thanks for the kind comment.
Regarding your observation I would like to point out that unfortunately orthopaedics as a branch has many emergency consultations some of which I delegate to my juniors but some of them I need to see personally which causes the occasional delay.
Nonetheless you have rightly pointed out this delay can be troublesome for the patients and it is our constant endeavour to streamline the system in order to serve my patients in a better way 
Thanx once again and sincere regards 
Dr Abhishek

Would only ever visit him for all future bone related medical advice.

tags: Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
******** ******** ******* ** ******* * ***** ******* ************ ******* *****

This is Saumya, I have a meniscus year on my right knee (hair line). On the first vist he had suggested me for an operation without doing 
any tests. After insisting he has prescribed me some medicines which is only available in his clinic (Hauz Khas) and indirectly asked me to take the whole course which was for months and which costs me ‚Çπ8,000 to ‚Çπ10,000. Dr. Abhishek and the compounder both instead me to buy the whole course of medicine as is works slowly and if I don't buy it than they will be not held responsible for not recovering. So I had buy the whole course *** ** ****** ****** ** ** **** * **** ***** ******* **** *** ***** ******** *** ********* **** ***** *** ***** *** ****** ********* ********* *** *** **** ***** ** ******* ****** ********** *******Please think twice before approaching him.
reply_text:
Dear friend ;
These days for meniscal tear in young patients arthroscopic meniscal repair is being done routinely World over.It is a minimally invasive surgery and hundreds of such surgery are being performed every week all over the world.
In fact ‚Äòsave the meniscus ‚Äòis the idea which is more pertinent for younger generation so whenever a young patient with a meniscal tear approaches an orthopaedic surgeon it becomes more of a duty of the surgeon to inform the patient about this treatment option.It is up to the patient to take the call whether he or she wants to undergo the knife as none can force surgery upon a patient.A doctor can just counsel the patient about the options available.

About the medication, everybody knows it is not a good idea to take painkillers for a long time and it is a common practice to use nutritional and pharmaceutical supplements for the purpose of repair and healing.As these are not painkillers they take a longer time to have their effect (what you are calling a long course )
In fact Rs.8000-Rs.10,000 is too little a price to pay for saving a knee without surgery.It is not only highly unlikely but completely impossible that anybody in my clinic would directly or obliquely suggest you to buy these medicines at my clinic pharmacy only.These medicines are widely available outside and everybody is welcome to buy it at their convenience.The pharmacy at the clinic is for convenience of patients who want all the important facilities under one roof.Medicines manufactured / marketed in the capital of a country cannot be called local and the same medicines from foreign brands and foreign manufacturers cost at least 3 to 4 times more which many people would happily buy thinking if it is manufactured outside India it will work better little knowing the fact that India is one of the largest exporter of pharmaceutical products worldwide.Similarly generics can be available at a lower price but sometimes the quality of generics can be questionable. I am really not sure about the doctors with whom these medicines were cross checked because I am pretty convinced that any busy orthopaedic surgeon worth his salt would have the luxury of having free time to advise you about just the medication prescribed by other orthopaedic colleague and considering you consulted many other Orthopaedic surgeons (Doctor‚Äôs )it is obvious the money you spent in consulting these doctors must have been way more expensive than the cost of these medicines which you are finding expensive or not reasonable.A doctor can only attempt to treat the condition With evidence-based and prevalent practises .A personal whim and a biased opinion helps neither the Doctor nor the patient.
Wishing you a speedy recovery
Regards
Dr Abhishek

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I had to come back unattended even after waiting for 1.5 hours. I am a working woman and it was a weekday. There should be proper procedure so that everybody‚Äôs time and money is valued. 

Although the treatment experience is good, the process of reaching to that stage is very bad. I had visited doctor previously for my fracture treatment and was happy with his treatment. So, even after my marriage when I shifted to another place I preferred visiting him for consultation. I am suffering severe pain in my knee and I don‚Äôt know when I‚Äôll be able to visit him or any other doctor next.
reply_text:
Extremely sorry for the long and futile wait.
You can connect to me directly please for further treatment if needed.
Rest assured your prior good treatment experience will be repeated.
Thanx and regards 
Dr Abhishek

context: Leg Pain,Foot Pain,Fibromyalgia,Lower Back Pain,Foot & Ankle,
review: Dr. Abhishek was quite professional and almost immediately recognised my issue and knew the very spot that has been aching for so long. He asked me to get an X-Ray done in his lab, which happened very smoothly. Based on my X-ray, he explained each and everything to me, in a layman's language and also prescribed me the right medicines. Unfortunate that I got Covid just 2 days after that and could not continue with those medications, but I will resume back soon.Very Thankful for such Experienced Doctors *** ******** ********* *** ************
reply_text:
Immensely thankful for your kind words of appreciation and wish you a speedy recovery both from COVID and foot pain both .
Thanks and regards 
Dr Abhishek

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
The doctor himself is so much sincere and dedicated. His staff is also polite, friendly and very prompt in providing all the necessary services before and after surgery. The doctor never charged fee for any post op. visits by the patient. We were provided all the care and assistance before & after the surgery. The doctor explains everything very well. He has a pleasant attitude and ample amount of patience. He and his staff are approachable whenever required. The staff also privided great assistance in reimbursement of medical policy of the patient which was really a huge help.
Hats off to Dr. Abhishek and his efficient team!!! 
They are doing noble job of providing medical services in the best possible and the most economical way.
reply_text:
Thanks a lot for your kind and considerate remarks.
These encouraging words go a long way in boosting the morale of doctors and other healthcare workers.
Thanks once again.
Regards 
Dr Abhishek

review: I'm a Bobirjon from Uzbekistan Nationality who proffesional football player. I had injured on my left knee during the playing of football match. I analyzed my knee and got negative result that  ACL was broken. I came to meet Dr. Abhishek to operate my knee. He reconstructed ACL of my knee in 2015. After operation i worked with significant physioteraphy with the following of Dr. Anhishek's recommendation to recovery myself to stand up to play a football again . Now i'm fit and enough strength. After operation, i have been playing a football as professional since 2 hears. I'm not felling any pain or weakness. Dr. Abhishek is such quality, proffesional, tramendous, and gold medalist doctor. Thanks to God and to Dr. Abhishek

tags: Value for money,
review:
Not recommended at all 
Doctor's fees for operation is too high for * ***** operation.
Doctor refer other doctor that do test only that particular doctor not others.
reply_text:
Nerve exploration and repair to make a hand functional is not a minor operation.
Referring to other doctor to check and document about the nerve injury and whether surgery is needed or not in the benefit of the patient is a normal practice worldwide and can only be doubted by paranoid patients.
In fact it is this category of patients who prolong their suffering because of their untrustful nature and lack of faith in the advising doctor. 
This patient's report was seen on priority basis and he was referred to a doctor (neurologist) working in Apollo whom the entire medical fraternity of Delhi respects for giving best reports. 
Instead of discussing his concern about the price with the doctor/staff, using a public forum speaks about the judgemental nature of service seeker.
